result.execSummary:
The defendant Lakisha D Hinton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lakisha D Hinton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lakisha D Hinton was found guilty of Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: To be paid within 20 days or penalty of 2 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lakisha D Hinton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lakisha D Hinton in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Count 2 to Theft contrary to section 13.102(c)(12)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Count 1 dismissed.

Court orders the following:
$100.00 to be paid within 60 days or 2 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Lakisha D Hinton did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 4:03 - scheduled at 3:00.  Defendant had transportation problems today.  Defense requests time for defendant to complete class and obtain certificate.  Court orders capias STAYED until the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Lakisha D Hinton in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense request adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Lakisha D Hinton did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lakisha D Hinton in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she went to Public Defender's Office in Milwaukee and she was eligible. Atty. Rosario appeared as friend of court. Public Defender does not have any information on the defendant.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation after court this morning.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint and only incidental contact with Demario Gray.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Lakisha D Hinton in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.
